com.placement.verify

Class Verify

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.placement.verify.Verify
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class Verify
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    The servlet is used to verify a request to register a mobile number to receive alerts. The design of this servlet is very special. This servlet is not for use by any application. It is to be used only by txtweb platform. The problem is that a server can not selectively serve clients, at-least not completely at application level Now for, that reason this class is designed specially. Using the txtweb platform and the data store. We can add a layer of security to this servlet. mutiple verify requests are not a problem. VERY VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: This servlet is very very very^tan90 times costly compared to other operations. Instance hours consumed by this is tremendous and few hundred requests can finish all the quotas. No optimization can be done on this servlet since the url call is synchronous( even if it is made asynchronous there is no use, since the main thread has to wait for this call to complete. And since the caller is txtweb we cannot even do much of anything.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • sendResponse

        private void sendResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse httpResponse,
                java.lang.String response)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used whenever one wants to say something to the user, ie the person who has sent a text message. It is strongly advised that you call this method no more than once in the entire servlet.(Not a requirement)
        Parameters:
        httpResponse - the response object sent by the servlet container
        response - the response text to be sent to the user, ie the person who has sent a text message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getTagValue

        private static java.lang.String getTagValue(java.lang.String tagName,
                           org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        This method given a tag name and an element within which the tagname is present.(UPTO 1st Level) It returns the content ie INNERHTML of that tag. Very very Important: if the tag is at a final most refined level ie it is a bare element, then it will throw a NULLPOINTER EXCEPTION Reason for not handling it: something catastrophic has happened to cause this, there is no point handling it now. And the wise thing to do will be to terminate
        Parameters:
        tagName - html tag to be searched within an html element
        element - the html element within which the html tag is to be searched
        Returns:
        the innerHTML/ content of that tag

      • verifyRequestFromTXTWEB

        private boolean verifyRequestFromTXTWEB(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp,
                              java.lang.String message,
                              java.lang.String mobileHash,
                              java.lang.String verifyId,
                              java.lang.String protocol)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method checks whether the message or the request actually originated from txtweb platform.
        Parameters:
        resp -
        message - message/text message body sent by the mobile user
        mobileHash - the mobile number of the user which is hashed by the txtweb platform
        verifyId - the verifyid is an id generated by a txtweb call to the application. This can be used to check whether the request is actually from the mobile user
        protocol - the protocol specifies the source through which the message was recieved SMS: 1000 USSD: 1001 WEB: 200x EMULATOR: 2100 INSTANT MESSENGER: 220x
        Returns:
        whether the message was verified or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when something is wrong response object

      • addMobileHash

        private boolean addMobileHash(java.lang.String usn,
                    java.lang.String mobileHash)
        Adds a mobile number hash along with the usn to the datastore.(must verify the request before calling this function). Not doing so might lead to inconsistencies.
        Parameters:
        usn - It is the identifier of a student. Primary key.
        mobileHash - the mobile number hashed by the txtweb platform
        Returns:
        whether the addition to the database was done properly.

      • checkSubcribed

        private boolean checkSubcribed(java.lang.String usn,
                     java.lang.String verificationHash)
        Checks whether a request is valid or not by checking whether the request was subscribed by the admin. It helps us to maintain consistency in our data store.
        Parameters:
        usn - It is the identifier of a student. Primary key.
        verificationHash - the mobile number hashed by the txtweb platform.
        Returns:
        whether the request was subscribed by the admin or not.
